title: Elanor Commercial IPO makes maiden investor pitch
text:
Elanor Investors Group is seeking to raise as much as $150 million for its Elanor Commercial Property Fund and has set the fund's listing date for early December.

Street Talk understands investor meetings are under way in Sydney and Melbourne this week with brokers Moelis Australia, Shaw and Partners and Ord Minnett spruiking an initial public offering worth between $120 million and $150 million.

Potential investors were told ECF would come to market with a $255 million market capitalisation and targeted gearing of 20 per cent on listing.

The deal has been pitched at a 7.2 per cent annualised 2020 financial year distribution yield, which is at the more generous end of the scale compared to other recent property floats including Home Consortium and Primewest which raised at about 6 per cent and 5 per cent, respectively.

ECF and its advisers will no doubt be keen to point out recent acquisitions, including 200 Adelaide Street in Brisbane, which sparked news of the new fund last week.

The deal's expected to be bought by yield-hungry investors, who have been rushing to back capital raisings by new and existing REITs, as well as a spate of credit funds from the likes of Partners Group and KKR.
description: The Elanor Commercial Property Fund is underway with investor meetings as it prepares to list on the ASX.
